# Government Tender Announcement: Request for Information (RFI) on Non-Emergency Marine Towing and Tug Services

### Reference: EP984-220001
### Release Date: 2022-10-12
### Tender Closing Date: 2022-11-14 14:00:00

## Request for Information (RFI)
The Government of Canada invites industry and First Nations, Inuit, and Métis partners to provide information, comments, and feedback on non-emergency marine towing and tug services in Canada.

## Background
Canada requires a wide range of towing and tug services in national and coastal international waters, including relocation of non-commercial government vessels, towing of wrecked, hazardous, and abandoned vessels (WHAV), marine animal carcasses, and other marine impediments and debris.

## Purpose of the RFI
This RFI is to gather information on liability and insurance clauses that could be part of future contracting tools, as well as capacity to provide a wide range of towing and tug services in Canada. The information gathered will help inform future procurement strategies.

## Important Notes

* This RFI is not a call for tender nor a Request for Proposal (RFP). No agreement, procurement tool, or contract will be entered into based on this RFI.
* Participation in this RFI is encouraged but is not mandatory.
* There will be no short-listing of potential suppliers for future work based on this RFI.
* Respondents will not be reimbursed for any costs incurred by participating in this RFI.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

## Request for Submission
The PSPC Procurement Authority, Katia-Annik Torkia, invites respondents to provide their information, comments, and feedback on the non-emergency marine towing and tug services. The submission deadline is October 25, 2022. The submitted information must be provided in writing and must not exceed 15 pages. The submitted packages must be sent to the email of the procurement authority.
